meanings.definition: Resembling a clump in appearance or structure.
meanings.sent1: The rocks formed a clumplike pile at the base of the hill.
meanings.sent2: The bushes grew in a clumplike fashion, creating a dense barrier.
meanings.sent3: The clumplike arrangement of toys on the shelf made it difficult to find what I was looking for.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, clumplike and tangled, was a mess after playing outside.
meanings.sent5: The clumplike clouds in the sky signaled an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of a clump.
meanings.sent1: The children ran clumplike through the field, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent2: She walked clumplike towards the group, her hands full of flowers.
meanings.sent3: The dancers moved clumplike across the stage, perfectly in sync.
meanings.sent4: The leaves fell clumplike from the tree, swirling in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The students lined up clumplike outside the classroom, waiting for the bell to ring.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of a clump.
meanings.sent1: The soup had a clumplike texture, with chunks of vegetables in every bite.
meanings.sent2: His handwriting was clumplike, making it difficult to read his notes.
meanings.sent3: The clumplike sound of footsteps echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent4: The fabric was clumplike and rough against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The cake had a clumplike consistency, crumbling easily when sliced.
